original: Ericson, Knut Herman, kyrkoherde, Norrköping, f. 31/7/9’3 i Gbg av Johannes E. o. Lovisa Andreasson. G. 20 m. gymn:dir. Greta Larsison. Barn: Lars-Gunnar f. 21, teol. o. fil. kand., Ulla 23, g. 44 m. kyrkoadj. Bertil Andræ, Kerstin 24, elev v. Sophia- hemm. i Sthlm, Anna-Greta 24, fil. stud. i Upps., Birgitta 29, stud. — Folksk :lär :ex., teol. kand. Kommin. i Carl Johans förs. i Gbg 29, kyrkoh. i Hedvigs förs. i Norrköp. sed. 42. Ordf. i De blindas skyddisvänner, ung-d:rådet o. Pauvres honteux, v. ordf. i !stiftets unigd:ràd, past. presid. i Norr-köp. Rotarykl. Skr.: art. i tidn. o. tidskr., medv. i predikosaml. m. m.
translated: Ericson, Knut Herman, parish priest, Norrköping, born July 31, 1893 in Gothenburg to Johannes E. and Lovisa Andreasson. Married in 1920 to gymnasium director Greta Larsison. Children: Lars-Gunnar, born in 1921, with degrees in theology and philosophy; Ulla, born in 1923, married in 1944 to church assistant Bertil Andræ; Kerstin, born in 1924, attending Sophiahemmet School in Stockholm; Anna-Greta, born in 1924, studying philosophy in Uppsala; and Birgitta, born in 1929, studying for a degree in primary education and theology. Became a curate in Carl Johans parish in Gothenburg in 1929, then a parish priest in Hedvigs parish in Norrköping in 1942. He was the chairman of the Association of the Blind's benefactors, the youth council and Pauvres honteux, vice chairman of the diocese's youth council, and pastor president of the Norrköping Rotary Club. He has written articles in newspapers and magazines and contributed to collections of sermons, and more.
